H0.text: What name is given to the temperature of -273.15 degrees Celsius. Absolute Zero Point

H1.text: What name is given to the temperature of -273.15 degrees Celsius. Cryogenic Threshold

H2.text: What name is given to the temperature of -273.15 degrees Celsius. Kelvin Null

H3.text: What name is given to the temperature of -273.15 degrees Celsius. 0 K

A4.text: This temperature corresponds to −273.15 °C, and is referred to as absolute zero.

A5.text: The Kelvin scale is defined so that absolute zero is 0 K, equivalent to −273.15 °C

A6.text: The temperature -273.15 °C is not referred to as cryogenic threshold; it is called absolute zero.

A7.text: Absolute zero is the lowest temperature that can theoretically be achieved, corresponding to −273.15 °C.
